alert.note: Alert for McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 8:32PM CDT until May 20 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Hill and McLennan County in Central Texas. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waco, Bellmead, Hillsboro, Lacy-Lakeview, West, Beverly Hills, Hallsburg, Northcrest, Lake Waco, Aquilla Lake, Tradinghouse Creek Reservoir, Lake Whitney, China Spring, Gholson, Abbott, Leroy, Ross, Aquilla, Wiggins and Elm Mott.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
